description: The music of North and South America is a rich blend of Indigenous, European, and African traditions, resulting in a vast array of unique and influential genres.

regions.name: North America (Folk)
regions.description: Characterized by genres that evolved from the music of European immigrants and African slaves, including Blues, Country, and Folk.

regions.name: The Caribbean
regions.description: A melting pot of African, European, and Indigenous influences, producing globally renowned genres like Reggae, Calypso, and Salsa.

regions.name: Mexico
regions.description: Home to diverse regional styles, most famously Mariachi, a symbol of Mexican culture worldwide.

regions.name: Andean Region
regions.description: Music from the Andes mountains, with a distinct sound characterized by panpipes and other indigenous wind instruments.

regions.name: Brazil
regions.description: A musical powerhouse known for its rhythmically complex and melodically rich genres like Samba and Bossa Nova.

regions.name: Argentina & Uruguay
regions.description: The birthplace of Tango, a passionate and dramatic genre of music and dance.
